name: Nathan Bird
bio: Software Engineering Student at Brigham Young University-Idaho
about:
I'm a Software Engineering student at BYU–Idaho, set to graduate at the end of this upcoming July. I'm particularly interested in (some) software design patterns and in recreating the performance/efficiency of systems-level concepts.
In a recent professional role, I interned as a Backend Web Developer at FamilySearch, where I built and maintained backend REST APIs, developed a large-scale web crawler for the Paris 2024 Olympics, and delivered production-level code that I was told was rarely assigned to interns. I’ve also worked as a programming tutor and research assistant where I mentored peers and contributed to mobile app development research for my university.
I'm highly adaptable and love to learn; I especially enjoy working on personal programming projects that allow me to explore new technologies and expand my technical breadth. Outside of tech, I enjoy board games, playing piano, choral singing, and editorial writing.
I served a proselyting mission for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints during the COVID pandemic, where I taught, performed service, and provided spiritual aid in Colorado and Brazil, in both English and Portuguese.
I am currently seeking full-time opportunities.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering
activities: Awarded full-ride BYU–Idaho Scholarship for academic excellence (top percentile GPA, 3.98)

experience.title: Programming Tutor
bullets: Mentored 40+ students across 8 university-level courses over 5 semesters, analyzing ~75K lines of code

Facilitated 100+ sessions covering software design principles in Python, C, C++, SQL, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, creating custom walkthroughs from prior high-scoring coursework to reinforce key concepts
Broke down code involving drag force, Mach number, gravity at altitude, and linear interpolation into simple steps for students in a notorious C++ physics simulation course

Demonstrated technical mastery and strong communication—one student sought my guidance through 3 advanced successive courses and offered private compensation over free university alternatives after my official role ended

experience.title: Backend Development Intern
bullets: Selected for 1 of only 2 backend intern roles from a pool of 30+ web/QA candidates
Recognized for exceeding expectations and trusted to write production-level code typically reserved for full-time engineers
Developed and maintained 7 REST APIs and microservices in Java Spring Boot, contributing 2K+ lines of production code

Designed and deployed a web crawler that ran for 9 hours overnight gathering data on 65K+ Olympians for a 2024 Paris Olympics initiative, directly enabling Olympic content search capabilities for the site
Authored ~800 unit/integration tests with Spring Boot and Mockito, increasing coverage to 95%+ across 7 services

experience.title: Research Assistant
bullets: Built ~15K lines of Angular Ionic code across 150 files as part of a comparative study on 5 mobile app platforms
Evaluated setup, learning curve, and maintainability by developing a full mobile app with 114 commits over 3 months
Diagnosed persistent incompatibilities between AWS Amplify and Angular, leading to a successful migration to Firebase
Synthesized findings across 15 key metrics, including build complexity, documentation quality, and dev efficiency, contributing to a 20-page technical report

experience.title: Software Consultant
bullets: Designed and delivered 4 custom Python-based solutions totaling 3K+ lines of code and 130 commits, spanning GUI development, image metadata tools, facial tracking via OpenCV, and SQL-based file management systems
Independently built a 3D scene renderer from scratch with only NumPy and OpenCV to visualize facial tracking data—an unrequested tool that impressed the client and enhanced calibration accuracy
